title: Alesha Dixon slams treatment of performing animals - but defends Britain's Got Talent's dancing dogs

Alesha Dixon has been criticised by some fans on Twitter for criticising the treatment of performing animals abroad while defending dog acts on Britain's Got Talent . 
The talent show judge appeared on ITV's This Morning on Tuesday to speak about her emotional trip to Thailand with World Animal Protection, and she promoted the #wildlifenotentertainers campaign and blasted the conditions many of them live in. 
She told Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby that it was "really depressing," adding: "It's all for our entertainment, all for profit." Alesha Dixon discusses animal cruelty in Thailand (Photo: ITV) She is campaigning against the treatment of performing wildlife (Photo: ITV) 
Alesha pushed for change to the conditions - which sees animals beaten and abused in the name of entertainment. Read More
